EXTRACTED VALUE: Unlike certain other X360 games that feel short and rushed for the launch window, Burnout Revenge has gameplay and replay value packed in spades.
It’s scary, different and great at what it does, with only a few missteps and a story that needs some more fleshing out. Bring on the sequel!
When all is said and done, Soul Calibur IV is a solid choice for any fan of the series and fighting games in general.
It’s unique, perfect for gamers of all ages, and most important of all, it’s a lot of fun!
It's got new game modes, enhanced visuals and multiplayer support. If you love Geometry Wars you'll love this.
As a graphical showpiece, DiRT is an unbridled success. It also happens to be an entirely enjoyable rally racer.
Unique to a fault. It's adventurous, dark, silly, and it'll keep you up at night whether you want it to or not.
Certain parts need polishing, sure, including AI and level design. But anyone craving superhero action should pick this title up immediately.
While I may not enjoy all of the new tracks, this is certainly the strongest song lineup with the most master tracks we’ve seen to date.
Excellent as it is, it fails to match the impossibly high standards set by "Chaos Theory." [Dec 2006, p.96]
The overall production and core gameplay make Saints fun and engaging.
It, much like Oscar De La Hoya, not only looks really good but also puts up quite a memorable fight well worth your time and money.
